name: multilevel
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a large building) consisting of more than one floor: The goods are stored in a huge multilevel warehouse. A network of staircases leads to multi-level reading rooms.
(of a course, organization, system, etc.) divided into or involving several levels of ability, importance, etc.: complex, multilevel governance structures We run a multilevel yoga class that is open to everyone. Synonym
multi-levelled
More examplesFewer examplesNow consumers prefer to go to the giant, often multilevel stores.She explains that the multi-level classroom means she has to prepare multiple lesson plans.The single-player multi-level game enables players to test their mental and physical abilities.
